      • getUniqueSuffixForTest

        public java.lang.String getUniqueSuffixForTest()
        Computes what ought to be a globally-unique suffix for use in this test to avoid, for example, duplicate key exceptions in the database. Currently this is computed by appending the current time to the name of the class, so that multiple runs of this same class won't conflict with each other either. The same value will be returned when used within a given test method.
        Returns:
        a String unique to this test class

      • beforeTestClass

        public void beforeTestClass()

      • beforeClass

        protected void beforeClass()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets called once before the first test...() method is executed. @Override this in your Test class. When multiple tests are run (e.g. in a suite) for every test method a new TestCase instance is created. The beforeClass() method is called only on the first instance of the test. Be aware of this when in beforeClass() you want to use instance variables - their values will be gone after the first test method call. Set them in beforeMethod() instead.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • beforeTestMethod

        public final void beforeTestMethod()

      • beforeMethod

        protected void beforeMethod()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets called before each test...() method is executed. @Override this in your Test class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
